result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian H. Dorantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant Christian H. Dorantes appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant Christian H. Dorantes in court in custody with attorneys David Malkus and Melissa Nepomiachi.  Haley Jo Rea appeared with intern Alyssa Hahn for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH E.G.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
